name: power sawing, with catalytic converter | power sawing, with catalytic converter | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/2059/documentation

All measured emissions are taken from an old (1993) EMPA report. The type of power saw probably does not correspond to the type described in the infrastructure, but this discrepancy can be accepted. This module should not be used if its relative high importance would be high in a certain environmental inventory. ;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

Includes the Inputs: power saw (infrastructure), fuel use, lubricating oil requirements, and some measured air emissions (including emissions from combustion of the fuel). The saw is equipped with a catalytic converter.
category: C:Manufacturing/16:Manufacture of wood and of products of wood and cork, except furniture; manufacture of articles of straw and plaiting materials/161:Sawmilling and planing of wood/1610:Sawmilling and planing of wood

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The type of machine whose air emissions were measured is unknown. Certain elementary flows or intermediate product flows are extrapolated from other geographical areas than indicated.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The module represents an example for an average technology used in Europe in the late 1990s
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: most data from one technical report
